org.sakaiproject.genericdao.hibernate
Class HibernateGenericDao

java.lang.Object
  org.springframework.dao.support.DaoSupport
      org.springframework.orm.hibernate3.support.HibernateDaoSupport
          org.sakaiproject.genericdao.hibernate.HibernateGenericDao
All Implemented Interfaces:
GenericDao, BasicModifier, InitializingBean
Direct Known Subclasses:
HibernateBasicGenericDao
public class HibernateGenericDao
extends HibernateDaoSupport
implements GenericDao

A Hibernate (http://hibernate.org/) based implementation of GenericDao which can be extended to add more specialized DAO methods.

Note: This implementation is so simple it is unlikely to be useful

See the overview for installation/usage tips.

Author:
Aaron Zeckoski (aaronz@vt.edu)

<A NAME="setPersistentClasses(java.util.List)"><!-- --></A><H3> setPersistentClasses</H3> <PRE> public void <B>setPersistentClasses</B>(<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/util/List.html" title="class or interface in java.util">List</A>&lt;<A HREF="http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/lang/String.html" title="class or interface in java.lang">String</A>&gt;&nbsp;classes)</PRE> <DL> <DD>Set the list of persistent classes that this DAO will handle<br/> This no longer requires this to be set before the class initializes Do this using Spring like so: <xmp> <property name="persistentClasses"> <list> <value>org.sakaiproject.*yourappname*.model.*YourObject*</value> </list> </property>

Parameters:
classes - a list of Strings representing the the fully qualified classpath and classname of persistent objects

cloneList

protected <T> List<T> cloneList(List<T> items)
Take a list of persistent hibernate objects and return non-persistent clones

Parameters:
items - a list of persistent objects
Returns:
a list of non-persistent cloned objects

count

protected int count(String hqlQuery)
This is a convenience method that DAO writers can use to do counts using any HQL, it is efficient in that it does not return all objects and only does the count

Parameters:
hqlQuery - any Hibernate HQL query of the format "from Blah..." or "select thing from Blah..."
Returns:
the number of items that would have been returned

count

protected int count(String hqlQuery,
                    Object[] params)
This is a convenience method that DAO writers can use to do counts using any HQL, it is efficient in that it does not return all objects and only does the count

Parameters:
hqlQuery - any Hibernate HQL query of the format "from Blah..." or "select thing from Blah..."
params - an array of values which are represented as "?" in the hql
Returns:
the number of items that would have been returned

makeComparisonHQL

protected String makeComparisonHQL(String property,
                                   int comparisonConstant,
                                   Object value)
Generates the HQL snippet needed to represent this property/comparison/value triple, will turn the value into a string, use makeComparisonHQL(Map, String, int, Object) if you want to deliver the object directly

Parameters:
property - the name of the entity property
comparisonConstant - the comparison constant (e.g. EQUALS)
value - the value to compare the property to
Returns:
a string representing the HQL snippet (e.g. propA = 'apple')

makeComparisonHQL

protected String makeComparisonHQL(Map<String,Object> params,
                                   String property,
                                   int comparisonConstant,
                                   Object value)
Parameters:
params - a set of params to add this value to
property - the name of the entity property
comparisonConstant - the comparison constant (e.g. EQUALS)
value - the value to compare the property to
Returns:
a string representing the HQL snippet (e.g. propA = :propA)

executeHqlQuery

protected List<?> executeHqlQuery(String hql,
                                  Object[] params,
                                  int start,
                                  int limit)
Provides an easy way to execute an HQL query with ? params

Parameters:
hql - a hibernate query language query
params - an array of values (you should have "?" in your HQL whereever the values will be inserted)
start - the entry number to start on (based on current sort rules), first entry is 0
limit - the maximum number of entries to return, 0 returns as many entries as possible
Returns:
a list of whatever you requested in the HQL

executeHqlQuery

protected List<?> executeHqlQuery(String hql,
                                  Map<String,Object> params,
                                  int start,
                                  int limit)
Provides an easy way to execute an HQL query with named parameters

Parameters:
hql - a hibernate query language query
params - the map of named parameters
start - the entry number to start on (based on current sort rules), first entry is 0
limit - the maximum number of entries to return, 0 returns as many entries as possible
Returns:
a list of whatever you requested in the HQL

findClass

protected Class<?> findClass(Object entity)
Find the class type of a persistent object, needed in the case that we are working with something that wraps it's objects
Override this if desired

Parameters:
entity - a persistent entity
Returns:
the persistent class type OR null if it cannot be found

checkClass

protected Class<?> checkClass(Class<?> type)
This does a nice bit of exception handling for us and verifies that this class is valid to perform a DAO operation with

Parameters:
type - class type of the persistent object to check
Returns:
A valid entityClass type resolved to be the same as the ones usable by this DAO

protected CacheProvider getCacheProvider()
Returns:
the current cache provider

public void setCacheProvider(CacheProvider cacheProvider)
Set the cache provider to an implementation of CacheProvider, this will be set to NonCachingCacheProvider if this is not set explicitly

Parameters:
cacheProvider -

Returns:
the cachename used for storing search results for this type of object

initCaches

protected void initCaches()
Creates all the caches for the current set of persistent types, this should be called in the init for the generic dao being used after persistent classes are loaded

invokeTransactionalAccess

public void invokeTransactionalAccess(Runnable toinvoke)
Description copied from interface: GenericDao

Specified by:
invokeTransactionalAccess in interface GenericDao
Parameters:
toinvoke - a Runnable wrapper from the tool layer

public void create(Object object)
Description copied from interface: BasicModifier
Create the object and assign it an id, if the object already has an id then it will be created using that id, if there is no id then one will be assigned to it

Specified by:
create in interface BasicModifier
Parameters:
object - the persistent type object to save (hibernate version must have associated hbm file)

public void update(Object object)

Updates the object (object must already exist in persistent storage)

Parameters:
object - the persistent type object to save (hibernate version must have associated hbm file)

save

public void save(Object object)
Description copied from interface: BasicModifier
Saves the object and transforms it into a persistent object if it is not already one and assigns it an id, if is already persistent then the object is updated

Specified by:
save in interface BasicModifier
Parameters:
object - the persistent type object to save (must have associated hbm file)
